message: Welcome to the ETS Sprints in June 2011 - this topic is for any discussion related to the discussion
I'm going to start working on finishing the namespace refactor.
If Chris isn't going to be here, I'll probably work on ETS documentation
I am here now!
What about drawing a poly-line where is the user that decide how to avoid other objects? ...  Ok ... there's a clear problem when you use the autoarrange button. Isn't it?
It messes up the placement, that is.
Barring objection, I am going to start on the traits.util changes I outlined here: https://mail.enthought.com/pipermail/enthought-dev/2011-May/029136.html
or enable?
Yes .... this is the idea
Yes .... but it should be done refactoring completely the application ....
Oh moving the whole app setup to Task
That is an interesting idea..
@RobertKern Sounds good.  There are 4 of us working on getting the demos and tutorials for Traits and Chaco up and running.

Hi all, I'm Eraldo and I'm here .... for me it is a bit late but tomorrow I would like to work on BlockCanvas to (right now) wrap it in Evisage (task to be precise) .... It is a sort of test before the attempt to refactor it entirely. What is your opinion ?
Right now I would like just to test task wrapping the original application
Are you talking about moving the canvas to Envisage?
Hmm, why not just do a migration to Task as part of the refactor?

Ummhmm, but back to your original question.  I think that once Ilan has pushed the namespace refactor, it might be good for you to create a branch on block canvas where you try to restructure the app.
I have to give you my apology ... I'm still using my fork :( .... It is the time to create a new branch
@eraldop Hey Eraldo.
Hi Anthony ....
the whole BlockCanvas app not just the canvas ....
envisage .......
You might be able to clean up the code a lot in the process.
(BTW Ilan is moving BlockCanvas out of the enthought namespace right now ~_~)
So it must be created from scratch more or less
Thanks to Ilan .... of course not just for this nemespace refactoring ... we all owe him so much!!!!
But there is nothing that will calculate a curve that avoids other objects.

By the way ..... BlockCanvas needs to be cleaned a lot .... and, from my experience ( I'm using it every day in the last couple of months to analyze seismic data) its weak point is the wiring tool and how the wires are connecting different blocks ... Is there a feature in envisage to draw a line between two point in the canvas avoiding the overlap with other "element" in it ?
Yeah I agree that the usability needs to be increased a lot.  There are parts of kiva that do the sort of drawing that you are talking about
Yes.
A graph layout tool like GraphViz can do that, though.
There is.  Also on init sometimes too.

moving the disposition of the blocks from up-down to left-right and connecting each "variable" through its connector instead of a single central point, together with the poly-line should be not enough but, at least, a step ahead
What do you mean Anthony?
I was talking about how the auto arrange button doesn't work
But you are right, even having the i/o lines start and end at the right spot would be a big leap ahead
It is time to go to sleep .... see you tomorrow!! And good ETS sprint

this should be affordable .... .because the starting and ending point are already used to detect which variables will be connected but the points to connect are "redirected" to the center of each block (up or down depending on the type of connection input or output)
Good night!
